newsitem.title: GERMANY: Commerzbank to buy U.S. firm Montgomery - sources.
newsitem.headline: Commerzbank to buy U.S. firm Montgomery - sources.

text.p: Germany's Commerzbank AG is in talks to buy the U.S. money manager Montgomery Asset Management, banking sources said on Friday.
The sources said the deal was expected to go through soon but no firm deadline had yet been set.
A bank spokesman added, however: "The fact that we are interested in a U.S. asset management firm is nothing new. We have been saying this for two years."

Speculation that the German bank was poised to take over Montgomery has been circulating for several months. Business Week magazine said in January that the deal had been delayed as details including price were finalised.
Montgomery Asset Management manages 19 no-load funds. Its total business has been estimated at $7.4 billion.
